sentence.Network_en: Several countries in eastern Europe are counting the cost of yesterday's earthquake.
sentence.Network_cn: 东欧的几个国家正在计算昨天的地震带来的损失。

sentence.Network_en: She was counting out 30p, mostly in small change, into my hand.
sentence.Network_cn: 她数出了30便士——大部分是零钱——递给了我。

sentence.Network_en: Many people act on impulse without counting the cost.
sentence.Network_cn: 很多人不考虑后果就莽撞行事。

entry.def: Not counting a particular thing means not including that thing. Counting a particular thing means including that thing.

example.ex: ...an average operating profit of 15% to 16% of sales, not counting administrative expenses.
example.tran: 不包括管理开支在内，销售营业利润平均为15%到16%

entry.def: If you say and counting after a number or an amount of something, you mean that the number or amount is continuing to increase.

example.ex: There is a 1,700-year-old tea tree still living in southern China which is more than 100 feet tall and counting.
example.tran: 中国南方生长着一棵已有1,700年历史的茶树，高100多英尺，而且还在不断长高。

auth_sentence.content: It isn't clear how long vote-counting will take.
auth_sentence.res_content: It isn't clear how long vote-counting will take.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: It isn't clear how long vote-counting will take.

auth_sentence.content: Counting becomes very, very important, he said.
auth_sentence.res_content: Counting becomes very, very important, he said.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Counting becomes very, very important, he said.

auth_sentence.content: Not that he's counting the days or anything.
auth_sentence.res_content: Not that he's counting the days or anything.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Not that he's counting the days or anything.

Sentence.sentence: Nonetheless, the developers of the Chinatown garage are confident with the technology and are counting on it to squeeze 67 cars in an apartment-building basement that would otherwise fit only 24, accomplished by removing a maneuver space normally required.
